metadata.title: Revealing the influence of national public health policies for the outbreak of the SARS-CoV-2 epidemic in Wuhan, China through status dynamic modeling

abstract.original_text: The epidemic caused by SARS-CoV-2 was first reported in Wuhan, China, and now is spreading worldwide. The Chinese government responded to this epidemic with multiple public health policies including locking down the city of Wuhan, establishing multiple temporary hospitals, and prohibiting public gathering events. Here, we constructed a new real-time status dynamic model of SEIO (MH) to reveal the influence of national public health policies and to model the epidemic in Wuhan.

sentences.segment_text: The epidemic caused by SARS-CoV-2 was first reported in Wuhan ,
China , and now is spreading worldwide .
The Chinese government responded to this epidemic with multiple public health policies including locking down the city of Wuhan ,
establishing multiple temporary hospitals , and prohibiting public gathering events .
Here , we constructed a new real-time status dynamic model of SEIO ( MH ) to reveal the influence of national public health policies and to model the epidemic in Wuhan .
